contentrichtext.text: '''Albert Viljam Hagelin''' (24 April 1881 â€“ 25 May 1946) was a [[Norway|Norwegian]] businessman and [[opera]] singer who became the Minister of Domestic Affairs in the [[Quisling regime]], the [[puppet government]] headed by [[Vidkun Quisling]] during [[Nazi Germany|Germany]]'s [[Occupation of Norway by Nazi Germany|World War II occupation of Norway]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://mediabase1.uib.no/krigslex/h/h1.html#hagelin-albert |title=Hagelin, Albert Viljam |accessdate=2008-08-29 |work= |publisher=NorgesLexi.com |date= |language=Norwegian }}</ref> A native of [[Bergen]], Hagelin was sentenced to death during the Norwegian [[Legal purge in Norway after World War II|post-war trials]]. He was [[firing squad|executed by firing squad]] at [[Oslo]]'s [[Akershus Fortress]], where many of the 37 individuals condemned for treason and war crimes were executed. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2011}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Hagelin, Albert Viljam | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Norwegian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 24 April 1881 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 25 May 1946 | PLACE OF DEATH = Akershus Fortress, Oslo, Norge }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hagelin, Albert Viljam}} [[Category:1881 births]] [[Category:1946 deaths]] [[Category:People from Bergen]] [[Category:Norwegian people of World War II]] [[Category:Government ministers of Norway]] [[Category:Executed Norwegian collaborators with Nazi Germany]] [[Category:Executed politicians]] [[Category:Members of Nasjonal Samling]] [[Category:Norwegian businesspeople]] {{Norway-politician-1880s-stub}} {{World-War-II-bio-stub}}
